DOC.detailed_description: Prescription opioid dependence increase creates significant public health burden , office-based physician lack evidence-based guideline decide maintenance detoxification treatment buprenorphine/naloxone . The propose study compare buprenorphine/naloxone maintenance ( Mtn ) vs. detoxification ( Dtx ) 18-week randomized clinical trail heterogeneous population prescription opioid dependent patient ( N=120 ) primary care clinic . Patients randomize Mtn Dtx 2-week induction period . Mtn design reflect usual care primary care physician include weekly drug counseling ( DC ) referral ancillary service . Dtx Mtn identical first 4 week ( stabilization ) follow randomization . In Mtn , buprenorphine/naloxone continue unchanged remainder study . In Dtx , dosage buprenorphine/naloxone taper zero next 3 week , patient receive additional buprenorphine/naloxone remainder study . Dtx patient offer thrice-weekly DC begin taper naltrexone offer 7 day follow last dose Bup . The study test hypothesis Mtn lead decrease illicit drug use demonstrate incremental cost-effectiveness compare Dtx . Relevance public health : The result study help define role maintenance vs. detoxification buprenorphine/naloxone care prescription opioid dependent patient primary care .
